snippet.title: Evidence for a Novel Reaction Mechanism of a Prompt Shock-Induced Fission Following the Fusion of 78Kr and 40Ca Nuclei at E/A =10 MeV
snippet.description: Evidence for a Novel Reaction Mechanism of a Prompt Shock-Induced Fission Following the Fusion of 78Kr and 40Ca Nuclei at E/A =10 MeV / Henry, E ; Toke, J ; Nyibule, S ; Quinlan, M ; Schroder, W U ; Ademard, G ; Amorini, F ; Auditore, L ; Beck, C ; Berceanu, I et al. An analysis of experimental data from the inverse-kinematics ISODEC experiment on 78Kr+40Ca reaction at a bombarding energy of 10 AMeV has revealed signatures of a hitherto unknown reaction mechanism, intermediate between the classical damped binary collisions and fusion-fission, but also substantially different from what is being termed in the literature as fast fission or quasi fission. [...] arXiv:1404.3758 ; UR-NCUR 14-032. \- 2014\. Preprint

snippet.title: Towards discrimination of MSSM and NMSSM scenarios at colliders
snippet.description: Towards discrimination of MSSM and NMSSM scenarios at colliders / Porto, Stefano ; Moortgat-Pick, Gudrid A ; Rolbiecki, Krzysztof One of the challenging tasks at future experiments is the clear identification of the underlying new physics model. [...] arXiv:1404.1053 ; DESY 14-042. \- 2014\. - 9 p. Preprint

snippet.title: Testing nonlinear-QED at the future linear collider with an intense laser
snippet.description: Testing nonlinear-QED at the future linear collider with an intense laser / Hartin, A ; Porto, S ; Moortgat-Pick, G The future linear collider will collide dense $e^+e^-$ bunches at high energies up to 1 TeV, generating very intense electromagnetic fields at the interaction point (IP). [...] arXiv:1404.0810 ; DESY-14-043. \- 2014\. Preprint

snippet.title: A Keplerian-based Hamiltonian Splitting for Gravitational $N$-body Simulations
snippet.description: A Keplerian-based Hamiltonian Splitting for Gravitational $N$-body Simulations / Ferrari, G Gonçalves (Leiden Observatory, Leiden University, The Netherlands ; Instituto de Física, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, Porto Alegre, Brazil) ; Boekholt, T (Leiden Observatory, Leiden University, The Netherlands) ; Zwart, S F Portegies (Leiden Observatory, Leiden University, The Netherlands) We developed a Keplerian-based Hamiltonian splitting for solving the gravitational $N$-body problem. [...] arXiv:1402.3325. \- 2014\. - 13 p. Preprint

snippet.title: The LHC Tier1 at PIC: experience from first LHC run
snippet.description: The LHC Tier1 at PIC: experience from first LHC run / Flix, J (Madrid, CIEMAT ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Perez-Calero Yzquierdo, A (Madrid, CIEMAT ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Acción, E (Barcelona, IFAE ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Acin, V (Barcelona, IFAE ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Acosta, C (Barcelona, IFAE ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Bernabeu, G (Madrid, CIEMAT ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Bria, A (Barcelona, IFAE ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Casals, J (Madrid, CIEMAT ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Caubet, M (Madrid, CIEMAT ; PIC, Bellaterra) ; Cruz, R (Barcelona, IFAE ; PIC, Bellaterra) et al. This paper summarizes the operational experience of the Tier1 computer center at Port d’Informació Científica (PIC) supporting the commissioning and first run (Run1) of the Large Hadron Collider (LHC). The evolution of the experiment computing models resulting from the higher amounts of data expected after the restart of the LHC are also described.. 2013 \- Published in : EPJ Web Conf. 60 (2013) 20054 Published version, Open Access article: PDF; In : 1st Large Hadron Collider Physics Conference, Barcelona, Spain, 13 - 18 May 2013, pp.20054

snippet.title: The VIMOS Public Extragalactic Redshift Survey (VIPERS): A quiescent formation of massive red-sequence galaxies over the past 9 Gyr
snippet.description: The VIMOS Public Extragalactic Redshift Survey (VIPERS): A quiescent formation of massive red-sequence galaxies over the past 9 Gyr / Fritz, A ; Scodeggio, M ; Ilbert, O ; Bolzonella, M ; Davidzon, I ; Coupon, J ; Garilli, B ; Guzzo, L ; Zamorani, G ; Abbas, U et al. We explore the evolution of the Colour-Magnitude Relation (CMR) and Luminosity Function (LF) at 0.4<z<1.3 from the VIMOS Public Extragalactic Redshift Survey (VIPERS) using ~45,000 galaxies with precise spectroscopic redshifts down to i'_AB<22.5 over ~10.32 deg^2 in two fields. [...] arXiv:1401.6137. \- 2014\. - 27 p. Preprint

The VIMOS Public Extragalactic Redshift Survey (VIPERS). Never mind the gaps: comparing techniques to restore homogeneous sky coverage
snippet.description: The VIMOS Public Extragalactic Redshift Survey (VIPERS). Never mind the gaps: comparing techniques to restore homogeneous sky coverage / Cucciati, O ; Granett, B R ; Branchini, E ; Marulli, F ; Iovino, A ; Moscardini, L ; Bel, J ; Cappi, A ; Peacock, J A ; de la Torre, S et al. [Abridged] Non-uniform sampling and gaps in sky coverage are common in galaxy redshift surveys but these effects can degrade galaxy counts-in-cells and density estimates.
